characters.name: Vraxen the Knife
characters.bio: A master thief who robbed the idol of Khar-Zul, prying free six of nine sacred emerald eyes before the shadows gained teeth. Escaped into moonlight with six gems worth kingdoms — and a new shadow wearing his own face, patient as carved stone.

characters.name: Soraya
characters.bio: A sell-sword of ruthless competence hired to escort caravans across the Ashen Wastes. When her employer sold the drivers to a blood-sorcerer, she killed nine cursed men weeping, slew the sorcerer slowly, and kept none of the gold — but stole the merchant's shadow and sold it in Pelimor's night markets. She tells herself it was justice.

characters.name: Aldric
characters.bio: A spice merchant who hired a sell-sword, paid bandits, bribed toll-lords, and sold his drivers to a blood-sorcerer — all to smooth a single caravan crossing. Survived, but had his shadow stolen by Soraya and sold in Pelimor. Now walks the Known World as a man without a shadow.

characters.name: Malachite Doss
characters.bio: A ruin-delver and scholar who found the Lamp of Suroth in the Sunken Ziggurat of Yeng. Lit it, buying one truth — his dead wife had never loved him, only his library — at the cost of one lie: that knowledge was its own reward. Left the ruin lighter and heavier at once.

characters.name: Kael Bloodhorn
characters.bio: Chieftain who brought 800 Veth warriors to siege the living Bone Citadel and lost 700 of them to its defenses. His last 100 were absorbed alive into the fortress walls — breathing, preserved, visible like insects in amber. He spent the rest of his life trying to free them. He failed. He never stopped.

characters.name: Tessaly Dorn
characters.bio: Spent twelve of Yarithax's cursed gold coins before reading the fine print. The Lich-King's grey collectors — thin men with ledgers who walk through walls and never sleep — found her. Unable to pay with soul or years, she worked eleven months as a debt-collector for the dead. She collected punctually. She understood the job. Her debt is paid.

characters.name: Pieter Vane
characters.bio: Broke his oath to a dead king for twenty gold pieces and a horse. The horse went lame. The gold was gone in a month. The dead king found him a year later in a dockside tavern — patient, unthreating, merely curious whether Pieter remembered the oath. He did. He'd never forgotten. He paid his tab and followed the dead king into the cold street. An unmarked tomb appeared on the north road shortly after.

characters.name: Conjuress Mel
characters.bio: Owed three favors to the demon Varek for spells cast during the Siege of Amrath. After delivering a letter to a dead man and stealing a year from a sleeping child, she refused the third favor on her wedding morning — and instead trapped Varek in a prepared circle and offered herself as his partner-collector of intangibles. He agreed. They work together now, harvesting happiness, certainty, and loyalty from the living.

characters.name: Varek
characters.bio: An elegant demon who collects intangibles — years of life, happiness, certainty, loyalty. Made a three-favor contract with Conjuress Mel, intending to claim her marriage as his final collection. She outmaneuvered him with a prepared binding circle and offered partnership instead. He accepted, genuinely surprised. Now they collect together.

characters.name: Urgha the Unmoved
characters.bio: A mercenary of fearsome reputation, named for emotional detachment. Killed four men before breakfast on the day she showed mercy. Hired to retrieve a tax collector's funds or his ears, she found he'd spent the money on physicians for his feverish six-year-old daughter. She sent her own physician instead, paid out of pocket, and kept neither money nor ears. She remained unmoved. She was furious about the mercy for years.

characters.name: Cassia Vorn
characters.bio: Last thief of Crimson Gate, burned with three thousand souls inside. Negotiated with a demon past all standard offers until it dropped its script and simply asked what she wanted. She wanted one name — the man who ordered the burning. She traded her certainty for it. She used the name. She is notably less certain now, but it was enough.

characters.name: King Aldous III
characters.bio: Won a desperate war by wearing the Plague-Bringer's Crown for thirty seconds — long enough to terrify the enemy into surrender. Reigned eleven more years: erratic, sleepless, speaking to absent people. When he died of ordinary causes, physicians found his shadow had been on backwards for years. The Crown was returned to a deeper vault at Ostern.
